alert.note: Alert for Dillon; Florence; Georgetown; Horry; Marion; Williamsburg (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wilmington (Northeastern South Carolina and Southeastern North Carolina - Wilmington)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued June 17 at 8:46PM EDT until June 17 at 9:15PM EDT by NWS Wilmington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Wilmington has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Northwestern New Hanover County in southeastern North Carolina... Pender County in southeastern North Carolina... Southern Bladen County in southeastern North Carolina... Southeastern Robeson County in southeastern North Carolina... Central Brunswick County in southeastern North Carolina... Columbus County in southeastern North Carolina... Southeastern Florence County in northeastern South Carolina... North central Georgetown County in northeastern South Carolina... Southeastern Dillon County in northeastern South Carolina... Horry County in northeastern South Carolina... Marion County in northeastern South Carolina... Eastern Williamsburg County in northeastern South Carolina... * Until 915 PM EDT. * At 845 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from near Penderlea to near Redbug to near Gresham, moving southeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect wind damage to trees and power lines. * Locations impacted include... Conway, Leland, Marion, Whiteville, Mullins, Burgaw, Elizabethtown, Red Hill, Horry, Iredell, Rowan, Tabor City, Loris, Chadbourn, Bladenboro, Bethel, Johnsonville, Lake Waccamaw, Pamplico and Fair Bluff. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Torrential rainfall is occurring with these storms, and may lead to flash flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Dillon; Florence; Georgetown; Horry; Marion; Williamsburg
